channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Robust Speech Recognition via Large-Scale Weak Supervision
item.description: We study the capabilities of speech processing systems trained simply to predict large amounts of transcripts of audio on the internet.

item.title: LatentGaze: Cross-Domain Gaze Estimation through Gaze-Aware Analytic Latent Code Manipulation
item.description: Although recent gaze estimation methods lay great emphasis on attentively extracting gaze-relevant features from facial or eye images, how to define features that include gaze-relevant components has been ambiguous.

item.title: Efficient Distribution Similarity Identification in Clustered Federated Learning via Principal Angles Between Client Data Subspaces
item.description: This small set of principal vectors is provided to the server so that the server can directly identify distribution similarities among the clients to form clusters.

item.title: Transition to Adulthood for Young People with Intellectual or Developmental Disabilities: Emotion Detection and Topic Modeling
item.description: This study is to explore how to use natural language processing (NLP) methods, especially unsupervised machine learning, to assist psychologists to analyze emotions and sentiments and to use topic modeling to identify common issues and challenges that young people with IDD and their families have.

item.title: FT-HID: A Large Scale RGB-D Dataset for First and Third Person Human Interaction Analysis
item.description: It has been studied either using first person vision (FPV) or third person vision (TPV).

item.title: Clustering Without Knowing How To: Application and Evaluation
item.description: Crowdsourcing allows running simple human intelligence tasks on a large crowd of workers, enabling solving problems for which it is difficult to formulate an algorithm or train a machine learning model in reasonable time.

item.title: Extreme Multi-Domain, Multi-Task Learning With Unified Text-to-Text Transfer Transformers
item.description: However, while there have been several attempts to train transformers on different domains, there is usually a clear relationship between these domains, e. g.,, code summarization, where the natural language summary describes the code.

item.title: HAZE-Net: High-Frequency Attentive Super-Resolved Gaze Estimation in Low-Resolution Face Images
item.description: Although gaze estimation methods have been developed with deep learning techniques, there has been no such approach as aim to attain accurate performance in low-resolution face images with a pixel width of 50 pixels or less.

item.title: Learning Hierarchical Metrical Structure Beyond Measures
item.description: In this paper, we explore a data-driven approach to automatically extract hierarchical metrical structures from scores.

item.title: BEVStereo: Enhancing Depth Estimation in Multi-view 3D Object Detection with Dynamic Temporal Stereo
item.description: To this end, we introduce an effective temporal stereo method to dynamically select the scale of matching candidates, enable to significantly reduce computation overhead.

item.title: FV2ES: A Fully End2End Multimodal System for Fast Yet Effective Video Emotion Recognition Inference
item.description: In the latest social networks, more and more people prefer to express their emotions in videos through text, speech, and rich facial expressions.

item.title: Variational Inference for Infinitely Deep Neural Networks
item.description: We introduce the unbounded depth neural network (UDN), an infinitely deep probabilistic model that adapts its complexity to the training data.

item.title: HiFuse: Hierarchical Multi-Scale Feature Fusion Network for Medical Image Classification
item.description: A parallel hierarchy of local and global feature blocks is designed to efficiently extract local features and global representations at various semantic scales, with the flexibility to model at different scales and linear computational complexity relevant to image size.

item.title: FedFOR: Stateless Heterogeneous Federated Learning with First-Order Regularization
item.description: For the more typical applications of FL where the number of clients is large (e. g., edge-device and mobile applications), these methods cannot be applied, motivating the need for a stateless approach to heterogeneous FL which can be used for any number of clients.

item.title: Deep Learning for Medical Image Segmentation: Tricks, Challenges and Future Directions
item.description: Over the past few years, the rapid development of deep learning technologies for computer vision has greatly promoted the performance of medical image segmentation (MedISeg).

item.title: Improved Marginal Unbiased Score Expansion (MUSE) via Implicit Differentiation
item.description: We apply the technique of implicit differentiation to boost performance, reduce numerical error, and remove required user-tuning in the Marginal Unbiased Score Expansion (MUSE) algorithm for hierarchical Bayesian inference.

item.title: Tree Methods for Hierarchical Classification in Parallel
item.description: We propose methods that enable efficient hierarchical classification in parallel.

item.title: Summarization Programs: Interpretable Abstractive Summarization with Neural Modular Trees
item.description: We demonstrate that SP-Search effectively represents the generative process behind human summaries using modules that are typically faithful to their intended behavior.

item.title: Social-Inverse: Inverse Decision-making of Social Contagion Management with Task Migrations
item.description: Considering two decision-making tasks $A$ and $B$, each of which wishes to compute an effective \textit{decision} $Y$ for a given \textit{query} $X$, {can we solve task $B$ by using query-decision pairs $(X, Y)$ of $A$ without knowing the latent decision-making model?}

item.title: Exploring Modulated Detection Transformer as a Tool for Action Recognition in Videos
item.description: We show that it is possible to use a multi-modal model to tackle a task that it was not designed for.

item.title: SDA-$x$Net: Selective Depth Attention Networks for Adaptive Multi-scale Feature Representation
item.description: To tackle this issue, we first introduce a new attention dimension, i. e., depth, in addition to existing attention dimensions such as channel, spatial, and branch, and present a novel selective depth attention network to symmetrically handle multi-scale objects in various vision tasks.

item.title: Uncertainty-aware Label Distribution Learning for Facial Expression Recognition
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new uncertainty-aware label distribution learning method to improve the robustness of deep models against uncertainty and ambiguity.

item.title: Rethinking the compositionality of point clouds through regularization in the hyperbolic space
item.description: In this paper, we propose to embed the features of a point cloud classifier into the hyperbolic space and explicitly regularize the space to account for the part-whole hierarchy.

item.title: LCRL: Certified Policy Synthesis via Logically-Constrained Reinforcement Learning
item.description: LCRL is a software tool that implements model-free Reinforcement Learning (RL) algorithms over unknown Markov Decision Processes (MDPs), synthesising policies that satisfy a given linear temporal specification with maximal probability.

item.title: Estimation of circular statistics in the presence of measurement bias
item.description: The objective of this paper is to present a method to estimate circular statistics and their statistical significance even in this circumstance.

item.title: Revisiting Discrete Soft Actor-Critic
item.description: We study the adaption of soft actor-critic (SAC)from continuous action space to discrete action space.

item.title: SoLar: Sinkhorn Label Refinery for Imbalanced Partial-Label Learning
item.description: Partial-label learning (PLL) is a peculiar weakly-supervised learning task where the training samples are generally associated with a set of candidate labels instead of single ground truth.

item.title: Benchmarking and Analyzing 3D Human Pose and Shape Estimation Beyond Algorithms
item.description: Experiments with 10 backbones, ranging from CNNs to transformers, show the knowledge learnt from a proximity task is readily transferable to human mesh recovery.

item.title: Feature embedding in click-through rate prediction
item.description: The embedding modules act as a way to improve baseline model feature embeddings and are trained alongside the rest of the model parameters in an end-to-end manner.

item.title: Can we do that simpler? Simple, Efficient, High-Quality Evaluation Metrics for NLG
item.description: We explore efficient evaluation metrics for Natural Language Generation (NLG).

item.title: Sparse Vicious Attacks on Graph Neural Networks
item.description: In this work, we focus on a specific, white-box attack to GNN-based link prediction models, where a malicious node aims to appear in the list of recommended nodes for a given target victim.

item.title: Learning-Based Radiomic Prediction of Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Using Image-Derived Phenotypes
item.description: Early diagnosis of Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (T2DM) is crucial to enable timely therapeutic interventions and lifestyle modifications.

item.title: Closing the Gender Wage Gap: Adversarial Fairness in Job Recommendation
item.description: We conclude that adversarial debiasing of word representations can increase real-world fairness of systems and thus may be part of the solution for creating fairness-aware recommendation systems.

item.title: Setting the rhythm scene: deep learning-based drum loop generation from arbitrary language cues
item.description: Generative artificial intelligence models can be a valuable aid to music composition and live performance, both to aid the professional musician and to help democratize the music creation process for hobbyists.

item.title: A Framework for Benchmarking Clustering Algorithms
item.description: The evaluation of clustering algorithms can be performed by running them on a variety of benchmark problems, and comparing their outputs to the reference, ground-truth groupings provided by experts.

item.title: ViTag: Online WiFi Fine Time Measurements Aided Vision-Motion Identity Association in Multi-person Environments
item.description: ViTag associates a sequence of vision tracker generated bounding boxes with Inertial Measurement Unit (IMU) data and Wi-Fi Fine Time Measurements (FTM) from smartphones.

item.title: Revisiting Image Pyramid Structure for High Resolution Salient Object Detection
item.description: Salient object detection (SOD) has been in the spotlight recently, yet has been studied less for high-resolution (HR) images.

item.title: A Data-Centric AI Paradigm Based on Application-Driven Fine-grained Dataset Design
item.description: Deep learning has a wide range of applications in industrial scenario, but reducing false alarm (FA) remains a major difficulty.

item.title: Dynamic Graph Message Passing Networks for Visual Recognition
item.description: A fully-connected graph, such as the self-attention operation in Transformers, is beneficial for such modelling, however, its computational overhead is prohibitive.

item.title: Improving Replay-Based Continual Semantic Segmentation with Smart Data Selection
item.description: Continual learning for Semantic Segmentation (CSS) is a rapidly emerging field, in which the capabilities of the segmentation model are incrementally improved by learning new classes or new domains.

item.title: View-Disentangled Transformer for Brain Lesion Detection
item.description: Deep neural networks (DNNs) have been widely adopted in brain lesion detection and segmentation.

item.title: Interpretable Edge Enhancement and Suppression Learning for 3D Point Cloud Segmentation
item.description: Second, we experimentally observe and verify the edge enhancement and suppression behavior.

item.title: Deep-Steiner: Learning to Solve the Euclidean Steiner Tree Problem
item.description: The Euclidean Steiner tree problem seeks the min-cost network to connect a collection of target locations, and it underlies many applications of wireless networks.

item.title: Dynamic Relevance Graph Network for Knowledge-Aware Question Answering
item.description: DRGN operates on a given KG subgraph based on the question and answers entities and uses the relevance scores between the nodes to establish new edges dynamically for learning node representations in the graph network.

item.title: MARIO: Modular and Extensible Architecture for Computing Visual Statistics in RoboCup SPL
item.description: This technical report describes a modular and extensible architecture for computing visual statistics in RoboCup SPL (MARIO), presented during the SPL Open Research Challenge at RoboCup 2022, held in Bangkok (Thailand).

item.title: An Outlier Exposure Approach to Improve Visual Anomaly Detection Performance for Mobile Robots
item.description: We consider the problem of building visual anomaly detection systems for mobile robots.

item.title: CoV-TI-Net: Transferred Initialization with Modified End Layer for COVID-19 Diagnosis
item.description: In this research, the PyTorch pre-trained models (VGG19\_bn and WideResNet -101) are applied in the MNIST dataset for the first time as initialization and with modified fully connected layers.

item.title: A Joint Imitation-Reinforcement Learning Framework for Reduced Baseline Regret
item.description: The learning process in JIRL assumes the availability of a baseline policy and is designed with two objectives in mind \textbf{(a)} leveraging the baseline's online demonstrations to minimize the regret w. r. t the baseline policy during training, and \textbf{(b)} eventually surpassing the baseline performance.

item.title: Review of data types and model dimensionality for cardiac DTI SMS-related artefact removal
item.description: As diffusion tensor imaging (DTI) gains popularity in cardiac imaging due to its unique ability to non-invasively assess the cardiac microstructure, deep learning-based Artificial Intelligence is becoming a crucial tool in mitigating some of its drawbacks, such as the long scan times.

item.title: Cross-modal Learning for Image-Guided Point Cloud Shape Completion
item.description: In this paper we explore the recent topic of point cloud completion, guided by an auxiliary image.
